channel.title: Nikonians News - Photography & Imaging News and Podcasts
channel.description: Nikonians - The Worldwide Home for Nikon Photographers - Photo News & Podcasts

item.title: Workshops headed west -- Indianapolis, Nashville, San Francisco included
item.description:
Nikonians Academy instructor Jim Stamates has Nikonians in Yellowstone National Park and Grand Teton National Park photographing amazing wildlife this week.
These workshops are truly unique since Jim is able to get participants to the best spots at the best times to photograph the best animals.

item.title: Hagen to speak at photoact 2012 in August
item.description:
Nikonians Academy Director Mike Hagen will be speaking at the photoact 2012 conference in Santa Barbara, CA this August 24th and 25th. A panel of 13 world-class photographers will speak on the art, craft and technology of photography through workshops, keynote lectures and breakout sessions.
Speakers include Uwe Steinmuller, Marc Muench, Christian Bloch, Bruce Barnbaum, Ken Rockwell and many more.

item.title: Shooting Motorsport
item.description: I do consider myself as a good marriage material. I am kind, understanding, I keep telling girls they don't look fat and patiently wait in a shoe store while my better half is trying 27th pair of shoes. The eye contact with the fellow sufferer is priceless. I am not that fat, I don't drink that much and I gave up smoking, shall we say quite successfully, more than a year ago. And now the best bit, I love cooking. As I've said, the dream. So what are the cons to all this?

item.title: ANPAT 12 details announced
item.description: The 12th Annual Nikonians Photo Adventure (ANPAT) is locked on. Nikonians Academy Director Mike Hagen tells us the dates will be October 12-20 and the location is...... drumroll......

item.title: Street photography
item.description:
If we want to talk about "street photography" we must talk about Henri Cartier-Bresson (left) and the old photograph taken in 1932 somewhere in France, with a man about to get his shoes quite wet on it first. Why? Because it is a mother of all streets photographs same as Henry Cartier-Bresson is basically a founder of this ever so popular photography style. 

All definitions of street photography, which could be possibly worded, are in that picture. Nothing and no one can describe what the street photography is about better, as this photo and two words: "decisive moment".

item.title: Monster Nikkor extreme fish eye lens for sale
item.description: Are you looking around for some new gear you can splash your cash on? Do you like to shoot wide? I mean really, really wide? Than this lens is made for you. Let me introduce you to the mother of all wide angle lenses, the Nikkor 6mm f/2.8 fish eye lens.

item.title: Nikon D4 Digital SLR - The Nikonians Review
item.description:
Nikonians Team Member Martin Turner takes the flagship D4 for a spin -

"...with an optical rating by DxO labs above almost every Hasselblad ever built, top ISO in excess of 200,000 and essentially noise-free at 25,600, this may well be the last camera you will ever need to buy."

Get the full review after the jump.

item.title: Nikon unveils new entry-level high level resolution DSLR
item.description: Nikon's newest entry in the Digital Single Lens Reflex (DSLR) category has been announced, along with a brand new FX-format high speed wide andgle lens.

item.title: Nikonians Academy Europe Workshops updates.
item.description:
Spring is in full bloom so let your cameras meet some mates and learn new things. Here are some ideas from Nikonians Academy Europe for the upcoming weeks, where you can do just that. The line up for following weeks includes:

"Master Wildlife Photography: Birds Of Prey"
"Master the Nikon i-TTL Flash System"
"Master your Nikon D90, D7000, D300/D300s, D700, D3/D3s/D3x In Depth"
"Artistic Nude / Beauty Photography Workshop"

item.title: Nikonians Northern Exposure podcast debut
item.description: Welcome to Peter Spence, host of our newest podcast series Nikonians Northern Exposure. Peter hails from Canada (which gives us a clue to the origin of the podcast series name).

item.title: Profoto Light kit passes Hagen test with flying colors
item.description:
Nikonians Academy director Mike Hagen recently proved the reliability of the Profoto D1 Studio Kit by taking it straight to an important shoot two hours after he unpacked it for the first time.

Mike’s adventure resulted in a successful series of images and a Profoto D1 Studio Kit Review, now available in our Resources at Nikonians® pages

item.title: Nik Software divorces Nikon... right?
item.description:
Seems the 2006 wedding between the two has been annulated. How much of a happy wedding that was is hard to say, but, we have been waiting for a follow up on the Nikon Capture NX2 a few years now and nothing is on, not even on the most sensitive of rumor radars.

Is the software some minority groups claim we'll still get worth waiting for, risking it will never come?

I would say hardly. Life's moved on and there are great, new tools out there. Take your pick, even if your new one does not come from Nik(on).

item.title: So much good stuff to read
item.description:
Our sponsor Profoto runs their own blog and I really liked what I read. You probably have heard of this vendor before, providing leading light solutions for professionals and ambitious amateurs alike. If you are into understanding more about light and how you can deploy their solutions to get the right light, check their blog.

We have had the luck to use their equipment on various locations, including on the community stand on various Photokina exhibitions.

item.title: Top 10 problems solved by members
item.description: Chime in to identify the top 10 issues solved by members for members and get an original Nikonians Photo Pro Strap as a thank you.

item.title: Nikonians invited to photoact 2012 workshops and conference
item.description:
Our friends at Rocky Nook publishing have arranged a "back to basics" conference and workshops series coming to California, USA this summer.
The two-day photoact 2012 comes to Santa Barbara August 24-25 and it offers attendees the opportunity to select their areas of interest in the art, craft, and technology of photography.
